0.1: "When Moshe ascended to the heavens, he found the Holy One, Blessed be He, sitting and attaching crowns to the letters. He said before Him,
0.2: "Master of the Universe! Who is staying your hand?"
0.4: "There is one man man who will exist after many generations, and Akiva the son of Yosef is his name, who will in the future expound on every crown and crown piles and piles of laws."
0.6: "Master of the Universe! Show him to me."
0.9: He went and sat at the end of eight rows [of students in Rabbi Akiva's Beit Midrash], and he did not know what they were talking [about]. He got upset.
0.10: As soon as he got to one [other] thing, his students said to him,
0.11: "Our teacher, from where do you learn this?"
0.13: "It is a law [that was taught] to Moshe at Sinai."
0.15: He returned and came before the Holy One, Blessed be He, and said before Him,
0.16: "Master of the Universe! You have a man like this, and You are giving the Torah through me?"
0.18: "Be silent. This is what I have decided."
0.20: "Master of the Universe! You have shown me his Torah; show me his reward." He said to him,
0.21: "Turn backwards." He turned backwards, and saw that they were tearing his skin with iron combs. He said before Him,
0.22: "Master of the Universe! Such Torah, and such reward!"
0.24: "Be silent. This is what I have decided."

2.0: And Rav Hananel said, Rav said
2.1: The underside of the phylacteries is a law to Moses from Sinai.
2.3: The rim of the phylacteries[through which the strap passes] is a law to Moses from Sinai.
2.5: The shin of phylacteries is a law to Moses from Sinai, and the groove must reach to the place of the stitches...
2.8: Black straps are a law to Moses from Sinai.
2.9: This is contradicted by a Baraita:
2.10: Phylacteries should not be tied except with their own type [of material], whether green or black or white;
2.11: He should not make them red because of disgrace and another thing.
2.13: It happened with a student of Rabbi Akiva, that he would tie his phylacteries with strips of tekhelet, and he did not say anything to him.  Is it possible that that righteous one saw his student and did not object to him?
2.16: He did not see him, and if he saw him he would not have let him.
2.17: It happened with Hyracnus the son of Rabbi Eliezer son of Hyracnus that he would tie his phylacteries with strips of purple, and he did not say anything to him.  Is it possible that that righteous one saw his son and did not object to him?
2.19: Certainly he did not see him, and if he saw him he would not have let him.
2.21: Whether green or black or white!
2.23: Here [refers to colors] on the inside, here on the outside.
2.24: If on the inside, what disgrace and another thing could there be?
2.27: Square phylacteries is a law to Moses from Sinai....

5.0: From the words of R. Jose, we can learn that even one who only studies one chapter in the morning and one chapter in the evening has kept the commandment "These words of Torah shall never depart your mouth" (Joshua 1:8).
5.1: R. Johanan said in the name of R. Shimon b. Yochai,
5.2: even one who only recites the Shema in the morning and evening [prayers] has kept the commandment of "never depart your mouth", but it is forbidden to teach this law to common people.
5.4: It is obligatory to teach this to common people!
